required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Irinotecan Liposome in Combination With 5-FU/LV Versus 5-FU/LV in Second-line Therapy for Gemcitabine-Refractory Pancreatic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Single-dummy, Parallel-controlled, Multicentre, Phase III Clinical Study of Irinotecan Hydrochloride Liposome in Combination With 5-FU/LV as Second-line Treatment for Locally Advanced or Metastatic Pancreatic Cancer After Treatment Failure With Gemcitabine-based Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate efficacy and safety of irinotecan hydrochloride liposome in combination with 5-FU/LV as second-line treatment for locally advanced or metastatic pancreatic cancer after treatment failure with gemcitabine-based therapy.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A randomized, double-blind, single-dummy, parallel-controlled, multicentre study
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: The maximum time in follow up was approximately 12 months
primary_outcome.description: OS is defined as the time from randomization to death due to any cause, or censored at date last known alive.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The maximum time in follow up was 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival was defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of disease progression, or death (any cause) on or prior to the clinical cutoff date, whichever occurs first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment every 6 weeks after initial response; maximum time on study 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Objective response rate was based on response evaluation criteria in solid tumors 1.1 (RECIST 1.1)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The maximum time in follow up was 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to discontinuation of treatment for any reason, including disease progression, treatment toxicity or death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Tumor Marker (CA 19-9) Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to treatment discontinuation every 6 weeks; The maximum time in follow up was 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Response was defined as a decrease of 50% of CA19-9 in relation to the baseline level at least once during the treatment period.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to treatment discontinuation every 6 weeks; The maximum time in follow up was 12 months

clinical_study.condition: Second-line Treatment for Locally Advanced or Metastatic Pancreatic Cancer After Treatment Failure With Gemcitabine-based Therapy

facility.name: Qinhuai Medical Area, General Hospital of PLA Eastern Theater Command
